Keep in mind this 5 ways that will increase your satisfaction:
 A-Friends
 B-Set goals
 C-Live life to its fullest 
 D-Money Isn't The Answer
 E-Keep Growing
 	 I really think that fifth one is key. If you can't learn, you can't improve.
 	 So choose the topic that you want to learn more about it by typing the corresponding letter .
Have you seen changes in what you believe over the past few months? That's a good thing.
Keeping an open mind pays huge dividends as the years go by.
But don't change everything — maintaining strong core values is important.
Knowing your family tree gets you a bump in satisfaction as well.
The Secrets of Happy Families: Improve Your Mornings, Rethink Family Dinner, Fight Smarter, Go Out and Play, and Much More
People who wrote about the history of their lives were 11 percent more likely to feel happy with their lives and 17 percent more likely to feel optimistic about the future.
People with goals are nearly 20% more satisfied with their lives.
A consistent amount of minor success produces much more satisfaction than occasionally bagging an elephant.
Not seeing the success you'd like? Don't give up. Having grit was associated with more life satisfaction.
The more materialistic people are, the less satisfied they are with their lives.
Spending more money on gifts made holidays less enjoyable.
Having meaning in your life increases life satisfaction twice as much as wealth.
it's not all about what you get from friends; giving is extraordinarily powerful too.
positive feelings about neighbors have been found to be associated with a 16 percent greater life satisfaction and a 25 percent lower likelihood of experiencing feelings of loneliness.
Having more close friendships was associated with a 19 percent greater life satisfaction and a 23 percent greater sense of optimism.
